title: BLS Pre-publish warnings
body:
I was trying to deploy everything to npm `lerna publish from-package` and got these warnings:

```
> @chainsafe/bls@0.1.7 prepublishOnly /Users/gregmarkou/Jobs/code/github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/packages/bls
> yarn build

yarn run v1.15.2
$ yarn build-lib && yarn build-types
$ babel src -x .ts -d lib
The exported identifier "_default" is not declared in Babel's scope tracker
as a JavaScript value binding, and "@babel/plugin-transform-typescript"
never encountered it as a TypeScript type declaration.
It will be treated as a JavaScript value.

This problem is likely caused by another plugin injecting
"_default" without registering it in the scope tracker. If you are the author
 of that plugin, please use "scope.registerDeclaration(declarationPath)".
The exported identifier "_default" is not declared in Babel's scope tracker
as a JavaScript value binding, and "@babel/plugin-transform-typescript"
never encountered it as a TypeScript type declaration.
It will be treated as a JavaScript value.

This problem is likely caused by another plugin injecting
"_default" without registering it in the scope tracker. If you are the author
 of that plugin, please use "scope.registerDeclaration(declarationPath)".
The exported identifier "_Keypair" is not declared in Babel's scope tracker
as a JavaScript value binding, and "@babel/plugin-transform-typescript"
never encountered it as a TypeScript type declaration.
It will be treated as a JavaScript value.

This problem is likely caused by another plugin injecting
"_Keypair" without registering it in the scope tracker. If you are the author
 of that plugin, please use "scope.registerDeclaration(declarationPath)".
The exported identifier "_Keypair" is not declared in Babel's scope tracker
as a JavaScript value binding, and "@babel/plugin-transform-typescript"
never encountered it as a TypeScript type declaration.
It will be treated as a JavaScript value.

This problem is likely caused by another plugin injecting
"_Keypair" without registering it in the scope tracker. If you are the author
 of that plugin, please use "scope.registerDeclaration(declarationPath)".
The exported identifier "_PrivateKey" is not declared in Babel's scope tracker
as a JavaScript value binding, and "@babel/plugin-transform-typescript"
never encountered it as a TypeScript type declaration.
It will be treated as a JavaScript value.

This problem is likely caused by another plugin injecting
"_PrivateKey" without registering it in the scope tracker. If you are the author
 of that plugin, please use "scope.registerDeclaration(declarationPath)".
The exported identifier "_PublicKey" is not declared in Babel's scope tracker
as a JavaScript value binding, and "@babel/plugin-transform-typescript"
never encountered it as a TypeScript type declaration.
It will be treated as a JavaScript value.

This problem is likely caused by another plugin injecting
"_PublicKey" without registering it in the scope tracker. If you are the author
 of that plugin, please use "scope.registerDeclaration(declarationPath)".
The exported identifier "_Signature" is not declared in Babel's scope tracker
as a JavaScript value binding, and "@babel/plugin-transform-typescript"
never encountered it as a TypeScript type declaration.
It will be treated as a JavaScript value.

This problem is likely caused by another plugin injecting
"_Signature" without registering it in the scope tracker. If you are the author
 of that plugin, please use "scope.registerDeclaration(declarationPath)".
The exported identifier "_default" is not declared in Babel's scope tracker
as a JavaScript value binding, and "@babel/plugin-transform-typescript"
never encountered it as a TypeScript type declaration.
It will be treated as a JavaScript value.

This problem is likely caused by another plugin injecting
"_default" without registering it in the scope tracker. If you are the author
 of that plugin, please use "scope.registerDeclaration(declarationPath)".
The exported identifier "_default" is not declared in Babel's scope tracker
as a JavaScript value binding, and "@babel/plugin-transform-typescript"
never encountered it as a TypeScript type declaration.
It will be treated as a JavaScript value.

This problem is likely caused by another plugin injecting
"_default" without registering it in the scope tracker. If you are the author
 of that plugin, please use "scope.registerDeclaration(declarationPath)".
Successfully compiled 13 files with Babel.
$ tsc --declaration --incremental --outDir lib --emitDeclarationOnly
âœ¨  Done in 6.03s.
```
